fields.description: It would be very useful to be able to pull and auto-stash beforehand, then re-apply the stash automatically all without the user having to do anything (if they have so set in their options) as this can really make life easier.
fields.summary: Auto-Stash

fields.description:
When sourcetree is running in the background, if on VS I try and save a file then I get the attached error from VS after getting a popup for the save as box which means it was unable to save the file successfully.

Unsure as to what could be causing this as there should be no need for sourcetree to be holding any locks or handles on those files at the time.
fields.summary: Having Sourcetree running causes file access errors

fields.description: The interface of sourcetree is rather slow, which is causing quite a slowdown in terms of the users. Is there anything that can be done as in reality the refresh and similar gui related functions could do with a massive boost to get it up to being usable.
fields.summary: Interface is extremely slow

fields.description:
It would be good to be able to have an option to update the interface much faster, as it currently takes a decent long while for it to show up with the latest  uncommitted changes. (I know you can press F5 but that is annoying)

It would also be nice to be able to tell sourcetree to update in the background as most developers have powerful machines so it shouldn't exactly be a problem if they want to have it on.
fields.summary: Update interface in the background option

fields.description: This would be quite helpful.
fields.summary: Ability to add tag for feature merge etc same as hotfix

fields.description:
Error occurs about being unable to delete the currently checked out branch & then the process seems to fail.

This is quite a problem as the branch does not get deleted & also remains on the remote.
fields.summary: When using git flow finish function

fields.description:
When doing a comparison between commits by choosing 2 commits for example in the log, it would be good to be able to generate a patch file / unified diff etc?

But mainly it would be good to be able to have some sort of full view for the changes because viewing the list of differences in the list at the bottom is far too small etc.
fields.summary: Commit Diff

fields.description:
Whenever there's an update, the updater will recognize that SourceTree is still running and offer to close that automatically, but later on it will complain about Putty.

Tracing the process ID back to the task manager, led me to the pageant.exe inside SourceTree's program folder. Killing that process allowed me to continue the update's installer.

The problem reoccurs on every new update.

It would be nice if the installer could take care of this tool as well so that I wouldn't have to kill it manually every time.
fields.summary: pageant.exe needs to be killed manually during every update

fields.description: When cloning a Mercurial repository with "Show Full Output" selected, once it is completed the output is not scrolled all the way to the bottom, hiding the "Completed successfully" message. It would be nice to have this scrolled for better visibility.
fields.summary: Scroll Dialog to Bottom When Cloning a Mercurial Repository Is Completed

fields.description:
In Visual Studio 2012 Git Extension there is a Sync Button. 

Sync does a pull and a push, which is very comfortable.

I would extend the functionality of Sync. When the working directory is not clean, it should create a stash, then do all the stuff and then apply and drop the stash. This could be optional. I think the automatic stashing would be good especially for users who migrated from svn to git.
fields.summary: Add a Sync Button to Toolbar

fields.description:
Please add support managing repos using the Windows Explorer Shell much like tortoise hg. There are many times that I don't want to have to break out into a full blown UI  - I just want to get things done quickly with specific files from Windows Explorer.

See attached image.
fields.summary: Windows Explorer Support

fields.description:
When you create a new file in a repo but do not Add it - provided that it is selected in the commit you will be prompted to add it as part of the commit action. The same does not occur when you delete a file - it should prompt to ask if you want to Remove the deleted files; instead it just tells you that nothing has changed. The prompt occurs for both add and remove in tortoise hg and I would expect the same here.

See the attached images for examples.
fields.summary: Deletion should should prompt Remove like Add does

fields.description:
Im seeing a lot of warnings coming through when connecting to Bitbucket about certificate fingerprints - this is just spam that 99% of users are not interested in. I also dont see this with tortoise hg, can you please remove this or hide by default. See the attached image for more information...

Example:

warning: bitbucket.org certificate with fingerprint 24:9c:45:8b:9c:aa:ba:55:4e:01:6d:58:ff:e4:28:7d:2a:14:ae:3b not verified (check hostfingerprints or web.cacerts config setting)
fields.summary: Certificate warning spam

fields.description:
I had a couple uncomitted modifications on .hgignore.
Pulled/updated from mainstream, which had another modification on this file.
I discarded the file, then I clicked ok on confirmation dialog, then it crashed with a dialog box.
When I tried to re-open SourceTree, it crashes on startup.
fields.summary: Crash on start after discarding conflicting file

fields.description:
SourceTree handles wheel mouse scrolling incorrectly. Rather than scrolling down, it scrolls up, and vice versa.
For example, in the Log/History view, if I scroll down my wheel mouse, this causes the window to scroll up.
If I scroll up with my mouse, the window scrolls down. This is the opposite of what should be happening.

This is happening only if the Control Panel > Mouse > Wheel is set to "One screen at a time" (instead of scrolling a particular number of lines)
fields.summary: Incorrect Handling of Wheel Mouse Scrolling on Windows 7
it would be nice if "check for updates" would use the proxy as well

fields.description: After update to version 1.0.4 in Mercurial settings I noticed the "Convert" extension. But I can not to find UI to use it. Could you please make some clarifications about supporting of this addon?
fields.summary: Convert explanation

fields.description:
It looks like Sourcetree doesn't allow you to click anything until every repo will be initialized.
It should be like that, it should allow to do something with current open repository, and other could be initialized in async mode.

Right now as workaround I've put repositories in folder and collapse it before exit. But it still too long to open such folder, since on opening it also blocks UI until every repo will be initialized.
fields.summary: Sourcetree launches too long with many bookmarks and open tabs

fields.description:
I was playing with the git-new-workdir script and trying to get it running on Windows, and managed to screw up my index a bit. That's completely my fault and I'm trying to recover it using git fsck (failing that I'll just copy it from another computer that is fairly up to date).

However, SourceTree panicked quite badly when when it tried to show its log/branch view. See the attached screenshot. 

This re-occurs every time I open it, so I cannot actually use any of my repositories at the moment since the dialogs re-appear faster than I can dismiss them.
fields.summary: SourceTree shows the same error dialog lots of times simultaneously when it gets confused by the repository index

fields.description: It would be a really great if Source Tree would support one of the greatest features of git: squashing.
fields.summary: Support Git Squashing

fields.description: Once Custom Actions are supported, it should be possible to add them to the toolbar. This references to the Mac Version of SourceTree https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-121
fields.summary: Repo Level Custom Actions in Toolbar

fields.description:
When a background refresh of a repository occurs, there is no indication of that happening. For larger repositories or when major changes are made outside of Sourcetree, it can appear that the application is non-responsive.

A simple indicator in the tab or likewise that a refresh is occurring would be very helpful.
fields.summary: Indication for when a refresh is occurring

fields.description:
If SourceTree is uninstalled and reinstalled, it runs on first launch but crashes on subsequent launch.

Bookmarks are a mix of both Git and Mercurial repositories. After removing all Mercurial bookmarks, SourceTree launch fine. Mercurial repos are created via TortoiseHg.

Crash report not attached, as it's 275MB.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on launch

fields.description:
There is no way to reopen a closed branch through the interface.

Asked on stackoverflow
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17373390/sourcetree-windows-mercurial-reopen-closed-branch
fields.summary: Mercurial - reopen closed branch

fields.description:
Here is the scenario as I observed it: (note that these' aren't proper hg branches, just different heads being tracked by bookmarks):

1 - On branch A - commit a modification to ~12 files
2 -on branch A - start modifying 2 files, don't commit because you realize you want these changes on branch B
3 - Shelve the pending files from branch A
4 - Update to branch B
5 - Unshelve the files on Branch B

When I unshelve, I get the modifications to the 2 files that I never committed in step 2, but I also appear to get the modifications that were made on Branch A in the commit from step 1. Those other modifications weren't part of the shelveset and don't belong on Branch B, but seemed to come along for the ride. I'm guessing this is somehow related to the fact that I shelved while branch B was checked out/active.
fields.summary: Unshelving appears to "leak" modified files between branches

fields.description:
1. Create a local repo
2. Commit some changes
3. Add remote repos that use SSH
4. Attempt to push to remote repo
5. SourceTree says "No changes to push", leaving you wondering why. It never says anything about incorrect private key.
This occurs when SourceTree/Putty is using the wrong private key, as a result of this bug: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/153759/sourcetree-for-windows-keep-telling-me-the-server-refused-our-key
There is no warning, so it is pretty hard to figure out without wasting time on Google.
fields.summary: Wrong Putty ssh private key results in  "No changes to push"

fields.description: It will be very helpful, to add context menu on tabs to add Close other tabs, Close all tabs to right functionality.
fields.summary: Close other tabs, Close all tabs to right, for repositories

fields.description: Just reporting crash... dumpfile is 350MB so not added here. Email bglenk@gmail.com if required. Thanks.
fields.summary: Windows crash

fields.description: There is no where that you can select all items using a checkbox in the discard changes screen. I want to be able to quickly select all items - this should be standard for all lists in the application.
fields.summary: Select All Toggle (Commit / Discard etc)

fields.description: It is usually standard windows convention to be able to toggle a check box using the spacebar. In the discard screen when selecting files this is certainly not working as expected.
fields.summary: Spacebar to Select Checkbox

fields.description: Something that would be useful for the discarding of lines, since in the diff view you can select multiple lines using ctrl, it would be useful to be able to select various different lines and then be able to discard them all at once without having to select each individual line and do the discard and confirm then go for them all as this is annoying & time consuming.
fields.summary: Discard selected lines

fields.description:
Something that may be useful for people who do things in custom ways etc, would be the ability to define either an override to the commands used in SourceTree (with placeholders that can be put in for SourceTree to use).

Or the ability to add additional command arguments which then are attached to the operations that source tree carries out.
fields.summary: Operations - Additional command modifiers

fields.description: For the various operations which SourceTree is busy carrying out, rather than having a progress bar which is in practice of no use other than to tell that it has not crashed, due to the lack of any real progress indication, would it not be possible for some sort of output from git to be read like --progress helps show(as is displayed in the console output) in order to fill the progress bar as it continues?
fields.summary: Push, Pull / various operations status

fields.description:
Not really sure as to the potential or how suitable this is as an idea, however I was wondering if it is somehow possible to perhaps have a push occur as a background process, or in most cases where SourceTree is taking its time to push, or similar the process could be put in the background in some form?

For example where the file status etc is displayed, perhaps have the progress bar etc there which could have an integrated status bar look to it and function as such which would be much cleaner & less disruptive.

If this is possible, it would be good to make it a permanent config option as well since otherwise you'd have to keep setting it for each operation.
fields.summary: Push behaviour - Background / non-blocking

fields.description:
I am unsure as to the possibility of doing something like it or what possible issues could be involved in doing so, however I was wondering if there is some way to be able to share the git flow config among the users who checkout the git repo, as in the current situation each user must make sure they have setup git flow for each new clone of a repo.

Also on the subject of git flow, it appears to be quite slow in terms of its performance, I did see an update recently which mentioned improving this performance. However I still think when SourceTree is calculating the next action etc for the dialog box it is rather slow and disrupts flow (pun not intended!)
fields.summary: Git flow - Shared

fields.description: It would be quite useful to be able to have a company wide shared config, so for example we can set various defaults and override other settings in the config, this would help prevent any errors or mistakes due to missed settings.
fields.summary: Shared config

fields.description:
SourceTree does not find any changes in my remote hg repository. So were do I see the std output of hg to find my problem. I do not see, if SourceTree/hg is able to use my proxy, but I get no exceptions.

Tobias
fields.summary: through proxy unable to pull from hg repository but TortoiseHG pulls without problems

fields.description:
I've installed an update of SourceTree yesterday, and this morning I happened to have an issue related to line ending handling.

A detailed explanation of the problem and solution is available at http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17362377/binary-equal-files-show-as-modified-unable-to-revert

Summarised, I think SourceTree has mixed configuration of the eol extension with configuration of the old win32text extension. Would you be able to verify this in your codebase?
fields.summary: Possible error with Mercurial line ending handling configuration

fields.description: TortoiseHg as well as most sane code editors display a red margin at the 80 character position. It would be nice to have this column available in the commit dialog, similarly to how TortoiseHg does it: http://i.imgbox.com/abrZdfwB.png
fields.summary: Add a red margin at 80 characters in commit message area

fields.description:
Here are my immediate thoughts.
I am sure my feedback is slanted by having used Git Extensions for quite a while now.

1. I really want a simple button to show/hide bookmarks view panel on left.
    I ended up closing them and leaving it closed forever I expect as its more annoying to open and close than its worth to have it waste space.
    In addition id almost set things up that bookmarks visible by default, but close if you double click a bookmark to open one.

2. Appears to be wasting a lot of space on the tab bar area for open repositories.
    
3. Let me shrink the toolbar, its very and I only need small icon or word for those functions.

maybe 2. and 3. can be combined so together they save a lot of space they currently use....

4. Commit dialog limits itself to inside the repo tab...
    Can you make it fill the pane not offset shadow over background its wasting space and there is only an artistic reason of the shadow edge.

5. Flipping from one repo tab to another is slow.
    how about just give me a seperate window with each repo, alt-tab would be fast then.

6. In Commit window - option to not show the staged changes, though you can drag lower pane to cover it - it reopens when i close and reopen commit window.

7. In Commit window - prefer path/filename list not  a file column and a path column.
   What im use to probably more than anything.
   
8. Diff's are pretty, but much space wasted in the diff view main window, and diff view in commit.
   lots of gaps around edges and between diff sections.
   
9. Shortcut key to launch external diff ?

10. Is it possible to unconfigure browser configuration ?
    I selected 'configure browser integration' menu option not knowing what it did.
fields.summary: Some notes when i first played with SourceTree thought you might like to see them.

fields.description:
This application seems to stop mouse wheel scroll acceleration from working.
    Microsoft mouse drivers support mouse wheel scroll acceleration moving the mouse wheel quickly makes it move much farther than slowly. Most apps support this and its extremely useful, this app seems to be ignoring the acceleration so no matter how fast move wheel it moves the same amount based on how far the mouse wheel is moved not on how fast it is moved.
    The likely scenario is that when you receive a mouse event for wheel up or wheel down you are ignoring the 'clickcount' field in the event when deciding how far to move. By ignoring this all wheel up or down events are the same default step size.

You can do mouse wheel scroll acceleraion with out microsoft drivers on windows using autohotkey and script that adjusts the clickcount field in events as per this thread http://www.autohotkey.com/board/topic/48426-accelerated-scrolling-script/

Ive run into a number of apps over the last few years that ignore it, and several have been fixed when i contacted authors about it.
fields.summary: Mouse wheel scroll acceleration not affecting scrolling.

fields.description:
Generally, teams have one branch that's considered the main line of development (usually this is the "master" branch, or if using git-flow the "develop" branch). It would be helpful if that branch was visually distinctive in the log view's graph.

Today I had to inspect the history of several branches, and every time I checked out a branch our "develop" line changed color and moved around. This made it difficult to keep track of what happened after doing several operations.

I imagine two ways to do this, possibly done together:

1. Keep the "main" branch fixed as the left-most branch. If the branch at the top of the list isn't the main branch, then its graph starts in the "second" column. (mockup attached)

2. Choose a color for the main branch. If the main branch is set to blue, then no other branch will be colored blue.

Both of these imply that the user can choose, on a per-repository basis, which branch is considered the main one.
fields.summary: Visually and consistently distinguish the "main" branch

fields.description: I think it would be useful if you had a "Rename Tag" option when you right click on a tag. Currently you have to delete a tag, then recreate a tag. This is pretty bothersome, especially if you make a spelling mistake.
fields.summary: Tag Renaming

fields.description:
I just got a crash in SourceTree for Windows while staging a new file. The log with a stack trace is attached, and I'll keep the dump file for a while in case you want it as well (it's 350MB).

The crash occurred when I dragged a new file into the staging area for my working copy. I had just changed the file in Eclipse and switched back to SourceTree and it had just started showing its refreshing icon over the staging area as I dropped the file. It then froze for 30 seconds or so before reporting the crash.
fields.summary: Crash while staging file when sourcetree was refreshing

fields.description: Clicked on a repo to open it. Source tree crashed
fields.summary: Crashed when opening a local repo

fields.description:
HubFlow: The GitFlow Tools Adapted For GitHub
http://datasift.github.io/gitflow/
fields.summary: HubFlow Support

fields.description: This is the way TortoiseHg displays things and it is very "readable" in terms of finding a closed commit
fields.summary: Display branch closing commits in Mercurial as squares or rectangles

fields.description: There seems to be a low number of color options for branches on large graphs.  See screen capture.  Makes tracing very challenging.
fields.summary: Color Rotation Limits on Large Graph

fields.description: See screen capture.  On initial load the horizontal scroll bar is present but when the application is moved from monitor to monitor its gets lost.
fields.summary: Horizontal Scroll Gets Lost Dragging App on Multi-Monitor Systems when Graph is Large

fields.description:
This is an optional column in TortoiseHg that comes in very handy as the merge manager of a large team of developers (about 2,500 commits a month).  It really helps instantly spot an abnormal commit or merge by a developer.  In Hg we also use a branch closing strategy after the ticket is closed, where the closed branch is merged to the main line to reduce dangling heads.  These merges *should* be a formality but we know there is a problem if this changes column is not blank.

Great product so far guys!  Your products are a keystone to our migration to GIT.
fields.summary: Log/History Column that Shows Counts for Modified Added and Removed Files

fields.description:
Font rendered in SourceTree menu and toolbar is worse than native app on Windows 7 with MacType installed. I use Mactype because it's better than ClearType technology.
I know this is general issues with .Net application font rendering, but maybe there is a way to enable MacType rendering in .Net application. Or maybe settings changes/toggle to activate full antialiasing ala Mac OSX/Ubuntu.
I attached image comparison between SourceTree and SublimeText2.
SourceTree seems to render font without any antialias technology applied. I'm not an expert with font rendering so maybe I just wrong.

MacType: https://code.google.com/p/mactype/
fields.summary: Compability with mactype font rendering

fields.description:
Format of 'Date' column of history list is 'd m yyyy h:MM'.
That is unfamiliar for Japanese user.
Use user's UI locale format or to be customizable.
fields.summary: Date format should be customizable

fields.description:
If I open the Commit dialog, uncheck some changes, add a message, then click the Commit button, I would really like the dialog to refresh and remain open if there are more changes left to be committed (the ones I unchecked).

Occasionally, I make a few too many changes before committing. I break those up into proper atomic commits, but have to keep clicking the Commit button after each commit in order to finish.

Very minor, but worth asking for. :-)
fields.summary: Keep Commit dialog open if more changes remain

fields.description:
The graft metadata is in the Hg changeset.  It should be shown in the revision information.  

Also TortoiseHg has also added a notation (dotted lines)  in the graph which I find invaluable.

I put this a Major because it limits my adoption over TortoiseHg although I would like a gui that crosses GIT and HG.
fields.summary: Reflecting Graft/Transplant actions in the branch graph

fields.description:
You can't enable largefiles extension without supplying a file location right now. This is distributed with hg 2.0 so we should allow this, but the user extension list only allows other extensions it doesn't know about to be enabled when the file path is supplied. Largefiles should be added to the list it allows.

Alternative: allow all extensions without a location. This would only work with exts which are embedded in all versions of hg, but maybe it's best just to assume the user knows what they're doing. That way we don't have to keep this list of provided extensions up to date.
fields.summary: Support largefiles as a builtin extension

fields.description:
Trying to clone a Mercurial repo with an SSH URL fails because the clone window incorrectly says that it's an invalid URL.

This is down to a space in the final install path (didn't happen in test versions because they were not in "Program Files") which wasn't catered for in specifying the path to the SSH tool.
fields.summary: Unable to clone hg via ssh
Allow SourceTree to stay in system tray

fields.summary: I dont know, it just crash and can not auto upload log file and dump file to server

fields.description:
This may have been resolved already, but I can't check that.

Please see the attached screenshots. Am I supposed to install all three? Or perhaps I'm supposed to install only one of them?

This is incredibly confusing.
fields.summary: Multiple updates available with similar file size

fields.description:
In 
Tools/Options/Diff/Merge Tool 
I selected KDiff3.
KDiff3 is installed in 
C:\Program Files (x86)\KDiff3\kdiff3.exe

I merged a feature branch in master and have a merge conflict.
I rightclick on my file and select 
Resolve Conflicts / Launch external merge tool.
It creates a number of files:
*.BACKUP.*
*.BASE.*
*.LOCAL.*
*.REMOTE*

But it does not launch KDiff3.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not open KDiff3

fields.description: It would be helpful to see the list of files as a tree (optional view maybe).
fields.summary: List of files as a tree

fields.description:
What Happens:

If a new clone of a repository is cancelled mid-way, the git.exe instances that are spawned to support that clone are not closed by SourceTree. Even upon exiting the application, the processes are still dormant in memory.

Furthermore, downloaded files are still locked by those instances of git.exe preventing their deletion!

What was expected:

Cancelling a clone operation would close all instances of git.exe. Also, all file locks would be deleted. Ideally the files from a half-cloned repo would also be cleaned as well (prompt??). 

Attachments:

Screenshot showing the spawned processes. Note that SourceTree.exe is NOT running at the time of this screen shot.
fields.summary: Git.exe remains open after closing SourceTree

fields.description:
It would be greate to have Export to patch functionality in SourceTree.
Console GIT client supports this [feature|https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-format-patch.html]
fields.summary: Implement export commits as patch file

fields.description:
Today i updated to 1.0.2 when i want to commit stuff (git) i always have to change the filter from "Show pending" to "Show modified".
Before the updated i did have to do that.
fields.summary: The Filter in the commit window does not remember it's last state

fields.description:
Autorefresh runs every 3 or so seconds, causing any files selected in Working Copy Changes pane to deselect.  It also deselects any lines selected in the Hunk changes preview pane.

Adding a configurable refresh parameter in seconds instead of checkbox in the configuration options would be one possible workaround, but ideally the refresh wouldn't deselect the selected files.
fields.summary: autorefresh causes selected files in Working Copy Changes pane to deselect

fields.description:
I have a hg repo with several changesets to be pulled/pushed.
When I click on the pull button, I've got the confirmation dialog, in which the list of changesets is OK.
However, when I click on the changeset, the detail of it displayed below is wrong, ie both the commit message and diff don't correspond to what's really inside the changeset. 
It instead display a completely unrelated changeset.
Seems that the "Push" dialog doesn't have the same bug, at least in my case.
fields.summary: Mismatch in the pull dialog
After push from Terminal red notifications icons in Toolbar wasn't updated

fields.description: When trying to update various branches, it appears unless I am mistaken that there is no easy way to pull in all the branches and update all the local versions in the local git repo.
fields.summary: Pull Functionality

fields.description: In Tools > Options > Mercurial you can enable extensions that are in your mercurial.ini, but they're only listed if they have an explicit location. This makes sense when the embedded Mercurial is in use (because you can't use an implied location if the Mercurial location isn't known) but when the user is using the system Mercurial we should allow user extensions with an implicit location, because they will have placed these extensions in their own hg install location.
fields.summary: Should allow extensions without location when system hg being used

fields.description:
When I close all tabs (CTRL + W), Sourcetree crash.
I've just update SourceTree today.
fields.summary: Crash on close all tabs

fields.description:
At the moment in the commit dialog there is no way to quickly check (for commiting) multiple files. It'd be useful if you could check selected file(s) by pressing space (as you usually can everywhere else).

A button to check and uncheck selected/all would be useful alternative, too.
fields.summary: Pending/staged files should be "checkable" by pressing space or via a button.

fields.description:
today, i upgrade the sourcetree to 1.0. when i tried to open a git repository,
it crashes. a huge file named SourceTree_CrashReport.dmp generated.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes when open repostiry. a huge dmp file generated.

fields.description:
The graph column alignment is too high vertically. (See screenshot).

This only happens for me on Windows 2012 - Windows 8, Windows 7 is fine. This particular Windows 2012 installation is a vmware guest.

*Workaround*
Change to a theme other than *Aero.Lite*
fields.summary: Graph column vertical alignment off

fields.description:
Program crash has occurred when I tried to create clone.
It happend after all files have been checkouted, and SourceTree added new Repository to left pane and was trying to update right pane (with a list of branches).

Unfortunately the program crash file is much bigger than 10 Mb (about 300 Mb) - so I had to split an archive.
fields.summary: Program crash has occurred when I tried to create clone

fields.description: When opening repository where flow was initialized in TortoiseHg SourceTree doesn't recognize that flow is already initialized.
fields.summary: Hg Flow doesn't recognize that flow is already initialized

fields.description:
I start SourceTree from a pinned icon on my taskbar. I run it maximised on my secondary monitor.

I would expect that if I close it and then restart the application, it would re-open maximised on my secondary monitor. Instead it opens maximised on my primary monitor.

If I don't maximise it, then it remembers which screen it was open on correctly.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not remember which screen it was last open on if maximised

fields.description:
# Right-click a branch
# Select Track Remote Branch and then a branch
# Right-click again and select Track Remote Branch, (None) is still selected
# Refresh with F5
# Right-click again and select Track Remote Branch, correct branch is now selected

You shouldn't need to manually refresh to see the correct branch tracking.
fields.summary: Need to manually refresh to show tracking branch change

fields.description:
Drag-n-dropped the gh repo to the repos pane and then doubleclicked the repo. And got multiple dings and error windows opened:

http://monosnap.com/image/geWwCrboThW3vRzAEZbgDqYE7/

IMHO it tried to open the repo details when the scan process not completed yet. 

http://monosnap.com/image/xk2KSb5AfnQK0aw4wfrllruUg/

The dump file is too large to be attached here, but I have stored it if you need it.

P.S. The bug is 100% repeatable on any repo in my registry pane: hg or git:
1. Open fresh ST window
2. Click the repo
3. Close the repo pane
4. Click on the different repo
5. Get the error message
fields.summary: Application crashes with multiple modal error dialogs when opening the repo

fields.description: Crash when Double click repository
fields.summary: Crash when Double click repository

fields.description:
I've just updated to SourceTree 1.01, and the incoming / outgoing commit numbers are very useful when I'm using a real Git repository. Unfortunately they seem to be bogus when using git-svn to connect to a subversion repository.

I've just pushed a series of commits to subversion using the git svn dcommit command, and am completely up-to-date with the server (using git svn rebase). However, the UI is telling me that I have 7 commits to pull and 9 to push.

Restarting SourceTree has no impact on this.
fields.summary: Pull / push commit numbers are wrong when using git-svn

fields.description:
I keep few references to multiple Git repos in the Bookmark list. Most of them are in folders.
After today's update to 1.0.1.0 the program starts crashing after closing "working copy" window.
I can reproduce the crash within 2-5 repeats
fields.summary: Sourcetree 1.0.1.0 crashes after repeatedly open/close Git working copy window from the list of repositories

fields.description:
In the Working Copy view there is a dropdown to select which group of files are displayed and a search bar to search through those changes. By default it is Show Pending and so only changes in the working copy are displayed.

If the list of files that match the dropdown is very large, then searching for filenames works incredibly slowly. This becomes very obvious if you change the dropdown to Show All so that all files in the working copy are displayed rather than just modified files. In the particular working copy I have there are over 61,000 files.

As far as I can tell, the search is restarted after I type each letter into the search box and the search itself runs in the UI thread (so more or less blocks everything else until it completes). This is a little frustrating in itself when the search is slow, since I normally know most of the filename that I am searching for (if not the entire name), and having it pause after I type is character is quite frustrating.

The end result is that the entire UI becomes unresponsive for quite a while. It's annoying enough with a repository on an SSD (~30 seconds or so), but blocks everything for 2-4 minutes on another computer I have that does't have an SSD.
fields.summary: Searching for a filename with the 'Show All' option enabled is painfully slow with large working copies

fields.description: Just reporting a crash. I cannot attach the SourceTree_CrashReport.dmp bause is too large (even zipped)
fields.summary: Crash report

fields.description:
I openned a mercurial repo, it looked nice.
It had a sub repo, I open it, it look nice.
At this point I had around 7 repo open, 4 git, 7 hg.

I wanted to close all repos.
I clicked quickly on closing the last one (subrepo) and the other one (hg)
then in then it apparently was not responding, I right clicked on the left area to create a new directory but the whole application was frozen (with the white layer which mean Windows didn't get any answer on activity I believe)
then it crashed.
fields.summary: Crash on closing all open repositories.

fields.description:
SourceTree had nearly finished checking out a repo for the first time but the GUI stopped responding. I could see progress statements up to about "Checking out files: 90% complete" and the scroll bar indicated that more statements had been printed below the current view port, but SourceTRee crashed shortly after clicking in the scroll bar area directly below the current scroll bar position.

I would have attached the crash dump, but at 410MB it's about 400MB too large.
fields.summary: Crash near completion of first checkout

fields.description:
the graph column shows the graph in the context of the current branch. sometimes we want to see the whole graph in the context of the master branch (so we can see all branches ever done on the project)

please add an option to open a graph window. in it I should be able to select a context of a branch to see the graph for that branch. additional filters might also be relevant.
fields.summary: Add option to view the graph in the context of another branch

fields.description: The public/private key in tandem with a list of authorized keys is a great way to secure access to a remote server.  SourceTree provides an excellent method for allowing connections to remote sites with PuTTY integration that automatically starts when the application starts; however, there is no option within SourceTree to close the service thus eliminating a layer of security for any remote site associated with the public/private key pair.  While this is convenient for users making changes to a repository, it is very incontinent having to close the agent every time SourceTree is opened.
fields.summary: Option to automatically close Pageant when closing SourceTree

fields.description:
I am trying to use SourceTree on Windows to clone a git repository over ssh from a Mac. When I do, I get an error that the server's host key is not cached in the registry, and it asks me if I would like to add it. I click "Yes" and it displays the same error. If I click "Yes" again, it will continue to show the same error over and over. I am unable to clone via SourceTree at all.

I am able to run "git clone" from the commandline to clone this repository. Once I do, I am able to add it as a Working Directory in SourceTree. However, I get the same error if I try to pull in SourceTree.

I have the same problem whether I use the Embedded git or the System git (both are 1.8.0).

I am using PuTTY/Plink. Switching to OpenSSH does not show the error, but it hangs and never returns when I try to pull.

The Windows machine in question is a VM running on the Mac I am trying to connect to. I am connecting using a bare hostname like this:

   monoceros:work/agent

I get the same error if I use:

   monoceros.local:work/agent
fields.summary: Cannot accept server ssh key

fields.description: See screenshot. Search for "diff" does work, but when you try to search for "diff in" it does not work. In the Mac Version it does work.
fields.summary: Search does only work for one word

fields.description: Split panels (for viewing the log, staged changes, working copy changes and diffs) don't remember their positions when switching between repositories or when closing and opening SourceTree.
fields.summary: Split panels should remember their positions

fields.description: Considering obviously that sourcetree is Atlassian's product as is Stash, it would be good if there was some really good in depth integration with Jira & Stash together as this could for example make people have more reason to adopt these programs due to their integration.
fields.summary: Stash integration

fields.description: Having the ability to turn on background fetch would be useful for users, as then they can see as things are progressing without actually having to do anything (can make SVN->Git) user migration easier.
fields.summary: Background fetch

fields.description: The ability to be able to select a range of commits or a from & up to commit would be nice if you could then say generate release notes from these
fields.summary: Release notes generator

fields.description: I know in all reality it can be viewed as a gimmick, but I think having some sort of support or integration of gource would be quite cool since its quite interesting to see.
fields.summary: Gource Support

fields.description: As the title suggests, to be quite blunt it would be good I think if you guys were to go and grab a copy of Git Extensions then just have a play and look around it and perhaps use it a bit, it would be beneficial as they have quite a few features which source tree would do well to have.
fields.summary: Git Extensions

fields.description:
It would be nice if the graph column, would maintain not only its arrangement but also its colours.

As when you make a commit or similar then glance back at the graph which is meant to make life easier, not only have all the branch lines switched around but they have changed colour so you then look back and follow it up only to get confused and realise they have all switched about.

Also it would be nicer if the branch lines expanded outwards more, as it is also possible to end up with lines in the same "ranks" as others which can be confusing.

These are just observations made by a colleague who I am trying to move over to Git instead.
fields.summary: Commit Graph - Colour changes

fields.description:
Refering to this post in Atlassian Answers https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/175568/sourcetree-windows-git-diff-branch1-file-branch2-file?page=1#comment-181747

Add a new Option to the right click menu in File Status. "Diff against branch" and this menu should have a submenu with all the branches to diff against.
Then we should only get the diff between the file in the current branch and the branch clicked in the menu.
fields.summary: Add possiblity to diff only one file with another branch

fields.description:
Maybe it would be to show the info of "git branch --contains" in the view like git extensions does to see the branches this commit is contained in (with "-a" to also see the remote branches).
Or the tags it is contained.
Or use git cherry to also see where it is cherry picked.
As I use the windows version I don't know if this is already implemented in the Mac version.
fields.summary: Show containing branches of a commit

fields.description:
Close tabs with middle mouse click - I'm using it in Chrome, Visual Studio, ... simply everywhere. But SourceTree can't handle it.
The feature would improve usability and navigation speed, clicking on the small X is difficult.
fields.summary: Close tabs with middle mouse click
